result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J. Rea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason J. Rea is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason J. Rea was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jason J. Rea was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Complete domestic abuse counseling successfully.  Ct. 1 is dismissed.

records.addlTxt: adding Ct. 3.

Defendant Jason J. Rea in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended complaint filed by ADA Lippert.  Reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 2 & 3 of amended complaint, with Ct. 1 dismissed.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 is dismissed.  Court withheld sentence placed defendant on probation for 2 years each count.  Conditions of probation are $543.00 costs each count.  Complete domestic abuse counseling successfully.  2 days jail credit. Domestic enhancer is to be added to Ct. 3.  Court orally added the enhancer.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Jason J. Rea in court with attorney Randall M. Holtz.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
